title: Provides that no school shall be in session on general election day
summary: Provides that no school shall be in session on general election day.

       Introduced  by  Sen. ADDABBO -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to school session days

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  8  of  section 3604 of the education law, as
    2  amended by section 46 of part H of chapter 83 of the laws  of  2002,  is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    8.  No  school shall be in session on a Saturday, GENERAL ELECTION DAY
    5  or a legal holiday, except [general election day,] Washington's birthday
    6  and Lincoln's birthday, and except that driver education classes may  be
    7  conducted  on  a  Saturday. A deficiency not exceeding three days during
    8  any school year caused by teachers' attendance upon conferences held  by
    9  superintendents  of  schools  of  city  school districts or other school
   10  districts employing superintendents of schools shall be excused  by  the
   11  commissioner,  provided  however, notwithstanding any other provision of
   12  law, that during the nineteen hundred  ninety-two--ninety-three  through
   13  the  two  thousand  two--two thousand three school years and thereafter,
   14  the commissioner shall excuse  a  deficiency  not  exceeding  four  days
   15  during  such school year caused by teachers' attendance upon conferences
   16  held by such superintendents, provided that at least two such conference
   17  days during such school year shall be dedicated to staff attendance upon
   18  conferences providing staff development relating  to  implementation  of
   19  the new high learning standards and assessments, as adopted by the board
   20  of  regents.  Notwithstanding  any other provision of law, rule or regu-
   21  lation to the contrary, school districts may elect to use one or more of
   22  such allowable conference days in units of not less than one  hour  each
   23  to  provide  staff  development activities relating to implementation of
   24  the new high learning standards and assessments. A district making  such
   25  election  may provide such staff development during the regularly sched-
   26  uled daily session and apply such units to satisfy a deficiency  in  the

    5  ence day be dedicated for such purpose.
